      • update

        public final void update(Game a_gameState)
        Dumps the game state into 'this' object. Effectively, creates a state observation from a game state (of class Game).
        Parameters:
        a_gameState - game to take the state from.

      • getRandomGenerator

        public final java.util.Random getRandomGenerator()
        Returns the sampleRandom generator of this forward model. It is not the same as the sampleRandom number generator of the main game copy.
        Overrides:
        getRandomGenerator in class Game
        Returns:
        the sampleRandom generator of this forward model.

      • getGameWinner

        public Types.WINNER getGameWinner()
        Indicates if there is a game winner in the current observation. Possible values are Types.WINNER.PLAYER_WINS, Types.WINNER.PLAYER_LOSES and Types.WINNER.NO_WINNER.
        Returns:
        the winner of the game.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Indicates if the game is over or if it hasn't finished yet.
        Overrides:
        isGameOver in class Game
        Returns:
        true if the game is over.

      • getAvatarPosition

        public Vector2d getAvatarPosition()
        Returns the position of the avatar. If the game is finished, we cannot guarantee that this position reflects the real position of the avatar (the avatar itself could be destroyed). If game finished, this returns Types.NIL.
        Returns:
        position of the avatar, or Types.NIL if game is over.

      • getAvatarSpeed

        public double getAvatarSpeed()
        Returns the speed of the avatar. If the game is finished, we cannot guarantee that this speed reflects the real speed of the avatar (the avatar itself could be destroyed). If game finished, this returns 0.
        Returns:
        orientation of the avatar, or 0 if game is over.

      • getAvatarOrientation

        public Vector2d getAvatarOrientation()
        Returns the orientation of the avatar. If the game is finished, we cannot guarantee that this orientation reflects the real orientation of the avatar (the avatar itself could be destroyed). If game finished, this returns Types.NIL.
        Returns:
        orientation of the avatar, or Types.NIL if game is over.

      • getAvatarActions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Types.ACTIONS> getAvatarActions()
        Returns the actions that are available in this game for the avatar.
        Returns:
        the available actions. An empty list if the game is ended.

      • getAvatarResources

        public int[] getAvatarResources()
        Returns the resources owned by the avatar. As there can be resources of different nature, each entry of the array indicates the amount of resource of each type. If the game is finished, we cannot guarantee that this information is meaningful at all (the avatar itself could be destroyed). If game finished, this returns null.
        Returns:
        resources owned by the avatar, or null if game is over.

      • getNPCPositions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vector2d>[] getNPCPositions()
        Returns the positions of the other NPCs in the game. If no NPCs in the game, it returns null. As there can be NPCs of different type, the positions are returned as an array of lists, each array for each type.
        Returns:
        a list with the positions of the other NPCs in the game, null if there are no NPCs.

      • getImmovablePositions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vector2d>[] getImmovablePositions()
        Returns a list with the positions of static objects.
        Returns:
        a list with the positions of static objects.

      • getMovablePositions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vector2d>[] getMovablePositions()
        Returns a list with the positions of elements that move, but are NOT NPCs.
        Returns:
        a list with the positions of elements that move, but are NOT NPCs.

      • getResourcesPositions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vector2d>[] getResourcesPositions()

      • getPortalsPositions

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vector2d>[] getPortalsPositions()
